text: there is no unity in the Security
Council when it comes to North Korea
you've got China and Russia Russia
saying of the United States position on
North Korea
regrettably aggressive rhetoric is the
only thing coming from the United States
we caught China saying similar things
and there's no unity there again to try
to stop North Korea from carrying out
yet another nuclear missile test is
carried out more than 20 this year we
all know that there are very deep
divisions in the Security Council it has
been shown in different situations
Syria's probably the one that has
attracted more attention I have to say
that in the case of North Korea
the Security Council independently of
the rethorical aspects that we have
mentioned was able to adopt in the last
few weeks two strong resolutions
probably they will not be enough
probably to be necessary to move further
but I think that the Security Council
unity is indeed essential in the case of
North Korea not only to put pressure on
North Korea that is absolutely essential
to what the North Koreans is doing a
violation of international law it's
totally unacceptable from the point of
view of the international community not
only for that but to create an
opportunity for diplomatic engagement
because the worst thing that could
happen in relation to the North Korea
situation is to move in a kind of
escalation and all of it all of a sudden
we will all sleepwalking into war so
these needs to be avoided happen I think
that can happen I think we need to avoid
it I think we need to appeal to the
unity of the Security Council and use
that unity also to have a diplomatic
engagement in order to be able to put a
stop to what's happening to make North
Korea accept that the objective of
denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula
is absolutely essential for peace and
stability in the region do you think
Donald Trump when he says things like
all options are on the table and that
when he says the sanctions that we've
seen imposed in the past few days on
North Korea and nothing compared to
ultimately what will have to happen you
think that kind of rhetoric might lead
to the United States sleepwalking into
military I think we have having any
rhetoric aspects in relation to these
crises coming from different areas you
have already mentioned several
my concern is that we move beyond those
rethoric aspects to the unity of action
that is necessary to both make North
